item.title: About Me
item.description:
I’m an undergrad studying EECS and French at UC Berkeley. I’m interested in developing tools to bridge communication gaps and transfer ideas, particularly through multimodal models and LLM inference.

Last fall, I worked at a stealth robotics startup, where I built and deployed an ultra-low latency ranging system. Before that, I spent time writing software at Rivian and conducting ML research at BAIR. I also built software and hardware for autonomous formula-style electric race cars at Formula Electric at Berkeley.

item.title: Affordable 3D Scene Reconstruction
item.description: This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.
